entry.RedBlue: An enigmatic POKéMON that can effortlessly regenerate any appendage it loses in battle.
entry.Yellow: As long as the center section is unharmed, it can grow back fully even if it is chopped to bits.
entry.Gold: At night, the center of its body slowly flickers with the same rhythm as a human heartbeat.
entry.Silver: Even if its body is torn, it can regenerate as long as the glowing central core remains intact.
entry.Crystal: When the stars twinkle at night, it floats up from the sea floor, and its body's center core flickers.
entry.Ruby: STARYU’s center section has an organ called the core that shines bright red. If you go to a beach toward the end of summer, the glowing cores of these POKéMON look like the stars in the sky.
entry.Sapphire: STARYU apparently communicates with the stars in the night sky by flashing the red core at the center of its body. If parts of its body are torn, this POKéMON simply regenerates the missing pieces and limbs.
entry.FireRed: It appears in large numbers by seashores. At night, its central core flashes with a red light.
entry.LeafGreen: An enigmatic POKéMON that can effortlessly regenerate any appendage it loses in battle.
entry.Emerald: It gathers with others in the night and makes its red core glow on and off with the twinkling stars. It can regenerate limbs if they are severed from its body.
entry.DiamondPearlPlatinum: If its body is torn, it can grow back if the red core remains. The core flashes at midnight.
entry.HeartGold: At night, the middle of its body slowly flickers with the same rhythm as a human heartbeat.
entry.SoulSilver: Even if its body is torn, it can regenerate as long as the glowing central core remains intact.
entry.BlackWhite: If its body is torn, it can grow back if the red core remains. The core flashes at midnight.
entry.Black 2White 2: As long as its red core remains, it can regenerate its body instantly, even if it’s torn apart.
entry.X: Even if its body is torn, it can regenerate as long as the glowing central core remains intact.
entry.Y: It appears in large numbers by seashores. At night, its central core flashes with a red light.
entry.Omega Ruby: Staryu’s center section has an organ called the core that shines bright red. If you go to a beach toward the end of summer, the glowing cores of these Pokémon look like the stars in the sky.
entry.Alpha Sapphire: Staryu apparently communicates with the stars in the night sky by flashing the red core at the center of its body. If parts of its body are torn, this Pokémon simply regenerates the missing pieces and limbs.
entry.Sun: Large numbers of these Pokémon make their home at the seaside. At night, a strange red glow radiates from the center of their bodies.
entry.Moon: This Pokémon gets nibbled on by Lumineon and others. Thanks to its red core, it regenerates fast, so it’s unconcerned by their snack attacks.

GoldSilver: Route 19, 20, 21, 34, 40, 41, Cherrygrove City, Cianwood City, Olivine City
LeafGreen: Cinnabar Island, Five Island, Icefall Cave, One Island, Pallet Town, Vermilion City
